word: 924. A lethargy of unconscious sensualism, through indulgence of a perverted appetite, a constant  submitting of soul and body and spirit to moral defilement, is upon the people. . . . And these lustful appetites, with their destroying power, have been transmitted from parents to children, and so intensified that the names of those who bear them are recorded in the books of heaven as transgressors of God's law.-- U.T., Jan. II, 1897.
